originalText.text: I really enjoyed the music and Pastor Hardrick's sermon. His sermon really spoke to my soul at a time when I really needed it. It made me feel like the message was made for me to hear. His message is real and relatable. During my visit the people were very welcoming and I didn't feel pressured to give a specific amount of offering but gave what was on my heart to give.

originalText.text:
TOURIST TRAP. Just don't go there. It's not a real church they just put up a poorly performed show with twenty local elderly persons possibly taken from a retirement home.
They ask you to pay 10 dollars to hold your backpack in a completely insecure hall and they explain that it's a real service so we are supposed to stay until the end to avoid to disturb the attending believers.
Nevertheless most of the attendance is composed by tourists and they are constantly entering in the "church" even while the priest is talking.
At a specific moment they ask everybody to standup and to walk in a circle throughout the whole church and reach some baskets with a suggested offering of 10 dollars each person.
It's a completely fake show just to raise some money from the tourists.
Please, don't go there.

originalText.text: I grew up as a Christian (methodist) and this was an odd experience. First of all, there was no proper warning about backpacks not being allowed and anyone with backpacks were required to pay 10 dollars and leave them by the entrance. During the service the pastor told everyone to pay 10 dollars as offering. I have never been pressured to pay a set amount rather giving to church should come from my own will and heart as it desires. I am all for giving to church and honoring God but the church seems to have very small number of members and 90 percent of the church was all visitors who were turned down by Abbysinian Baptist. It seems the bag charge and forced offering are what keeps the church going but I think it's extremely  unethical and dishonoring God. I wanted to attend a church and not miss my weekly service but attending here was not a pleasant experience for me and if you planned to go to abbysinian but couldn't try to avoid this one but search for other churches that will welcome anyone and everyone regardless how much they give.

originalText.text: My family attended a funeral service at this Church this afternoon. A close friend of the family. As my cousins were setting up for the Repass they asked if they could use the oven since some of the food brought in was cold. They were told the oven wasnâ€™t in the contract. Then the 2 members spoke to each other in private and asked for $50. They gave the gentleman the $50 which went in his pocket. He then overheard them sending my neice to the store for ice and showed them their ice maker and said this isnâ€™t free either. My family told him No Thank You. How do you expect to bring people to Christ when they observe Church folks behaving this way. Unacceptable
